item.title: A Trailer For The Super Mario Galaxy Movie Will Debut This Month, It's Claimed
item.content:encoded:
Ahead of 'Wicked: For Good'

If you're itching to see what The Super Mario Galaxy Movie will actually look like, then you might not have much longer to wait.

According to movie scoops outlet My Time to Shine (thanks, VGC), the next trailer for the upcoming flick will be presented before showings for Wicked: For Good. If accurate, this presumably means that the trailer will get its debut either on 21st November, which is when Wicked: For Good releases, or at some point beforehand.

Now, it doesn't sound like a very Nintendo move to just let the trailer play in theatres without any kind of build-up, so we'd imagine that there would be some sort of Direct showcase in which Miyamoto reveals the trailer himself, followed by Chris Pratt reiterating how much he just loves to stomp those darn Koopas.

Whether this claim is accurate or not, The Super Mario Galaxy Movie is releasing on 3rd April 2026, so Nintendo and Illumination will likely want to kick off the marketing campaign pretty soon.

The upcoming movie is a direct sequel to The Super Mario Bros. Movie, which released back in 2023. Actors Chris Pratt, Anya Taylor-Joy, Jack Black, Charlie Day, Keegan-Michael Key, and Kevin Michael Richardson are all set to reprise their roles.

The movie's title was revealed during the most recent Nintendo Direct, during which the 40th anniversary of Super Mario Bros. was recognised with several key announcements.

Will you be checking out The Super Mario Galaxy Movie? What scenes from the games are you hoping to see represented? Let us know.

[source x.com, via videogameschronicle.com]

Nintendo Life‚Äôs resident horror fanatic, when he‚Äôs not knee-deep in Resident Evil and Silent Hill lore, Ollie likes to dive into a good horror book while nursing a lovely cup of tea. He also enjoys long walks and listens to everything from TOOL to Chuck Berry.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply


https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/11/a-trailer-for-the-super-mario-galaxy-movie-will-debut-this-month-its-claimed

item.title: Battlefield 6‚Äôs Maps Proven to Be Smaller Than Most Series‚Äô Maps In New Community Effort
item.content:encoded:
Many fans of the series feel that Battlefield 6's maps are smaller than the rest of the series, and it seems like they were right, judging from a comparison put together by a member of the community.

Over on the Battlefield subreddit, user ClaraTheRed shared a couple of comparison images that show all of the series' 87 maps, their total and playable area, their shapes and how they rank in terms of size.

The findings are not in the Battlefield 6 maps' favor at all. The game's largest map, Operation Firestorm, a remade version of Battlefield 3's map, ranks 32nd in terms of playable space. It is also considerably smaller than the original, which ranks at 7th in terms of playable area.

Every other Battlefield 6 map ranks relatively low in the total ranking for playable space. Mirak Valley is the largest of the game's original maps, ranking 35th, while the smallest, Saints Quarter, is also the 2nd smallest map in the entire series. As such, those who felt that the game's maps were small were clearly onto something, even without doing an accurate comparison as the user ClaraTheRed did.

While many of the largest maps in the series were DLC maps released long after each respective game, there's no denying that Battlefield 6's maps do leave something to be desired in terms of playable space, even compared to the launch maps of previous entries in the series. With the community being rather vocal about this matter, it will be interesting to see if the developer will take this feedback into account for future maps, as they have been doing for some other aspects of the game, including the removal of a skin that the community felt didn't fit the setting at all.

Battlefield 6 is now available on PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, and Xbox Series S. Learn more about the latest entry in the series by checking out David Carcasole's review.

Follow Wccftech on Google or add us as a preferred source, to get our news coverage and reviews in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/battlefield-6s-maps-proven-small/

item.title: Cyberpunk creator teases he has "ways" of bringing Keanny Reeveshand back from the dead in Cyberpunk 2
item.content:encoded:
Resurrecting deceased video game celebrities is apparently another of Mike Pondsmith's many powers

Warning: Spoilers for Cyberpunk 2077 lie ahead.

Tabletop wizard and cool glasses-wearer Mike Pondsmith has teased having "ways" to bring Johnny Silverhand back in Cyberpunk 2077's sequel. Actor and serial whoa merchant Keanu Reeves hasn't been shy about being open to reprising the role were the opportunity to crash through his door waving some mantis blades about, but reconciling such a thing with the events of the first game could prove a bit complex.

This isn't the first time Pondsmith's let loose potential details about Cyberpunk 2, which developers CD Projekt have otherwise remained pretty tight-lipped about while they work away at it. Back in May, he alluded to having chatted to a dev at the studio about a city which "feels more like Chicago gone wrong" that's visited during the course of the game.

Pondsmith said more words during a recent interview on a CD Projekt livestream. "You know, not that long ago, I saw that Keanu would like to find a way to come back from the dead and play Johnny again," he mentioned, alluding to Reeves' declariation of being down to return to the role. "I have ways to do that, Keanu. Contact me."

The tabletop man refused to elaborate any further, as people who mention having mysterious ways to accomplish things often do. I assume the obvious way would be to have a Punch and Judy-style Silverhand puppet narrate the main menu, as the moon man of fellow RPG The Outer Worlds 2 does. Think about it, every time there's a plot twist, he can have a sarcastic moan about you, a gonk, having gonkishly erred in trusting certain chooms, gonkishly. He'd have seen it coming years before you did, gonkchoom.

In all seriousness, the only answers that'd make much sense would be if the sequel turns out to be a prequel to the events of the first game, or leans into flashback at certain points as that first Cyberpunk does. Either that, or some nonsense about there being extra hard drives knocking about somewhere in the real or net bits of the Cyberpunk universe with even more copies of the Silversonality on them.

Personally, I think I'd prefer it if Silverhand's story concluded in the first game, and the sequel moves on to fresh ground with minimal retreading. A brief cameo via flashback might be cool, but isn't worth doing just for the sake of it. In this interview, Pondsmith mentioned how blown away he was by CD Projekt getting Idris Elba for Phantom Liberty, and half jokes that he'd like to see Scarlett Johansson next. Sure, why not, but I reckon Cyberpunk's better off not being totally stuffed to the gills with every celeb possible, like a cyberware-heavy Christmas pantomime. That's what keeps the odd cameo in a role which fits the actor being cast feeling special.



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/cyberpunk-creator-teases-he-has-ways-of-bringing-keanny-reeveshand-back-from-the-dead-in-cyberpunk-2

item.title: Some Super Clever Folks Got Doom Running On A Goddamn Satellite
item.content:encoded:
Surely by now you‚Äôve heard it all: Doom running on an alarm clock, inside Fortnite, on a simple PDF, and even on human bacteria. It seems like Doom can run on anything. But what about running Doom on a satellite orbiting the planet while also using images of the Earth taken by the very satellite running the game for the game‚Äôs backdrops? Well, some very clever folks managed to pull off that very thing.

Ubuntu Summit is a yearly gathering of Linux professionals and enthusiasts where folks show off cool stuff they‚Äôre doing with one of the most popular Linux desktop distributions out there. This year, programmer √ìlafur Waage dove into how a bunch of clever folks not only got Doom running on an orbital satellite last year, but also how they were able to replace the game‚Äôs background image of the terrain and skies of Hell with photos of Earth taken by the satellite (h/t Tom‚Äôs Hardware). It was no easy feat, but it resulted in a new frontier for Doom ports. Check out Waage‚Äôs presentation of Doom in space during the summit here (starting at 46:00 or so).

While he was working on a project to get Doom running in C++ as opposed to its original programming language, C, Waage was contacted by Georges Labr√®che, a spacecraft operations engineer at the European Space Agency, about the prospect of running Doom on the ESA‚Äôs OP-SAT satellite.

OP-SAT presented an excellent opportunity for the ESA, as an experimental platform for unique tests on a device orbiting the Earth made out of (mostly) off-the-shelf computer parts and housed in a device not much larger than a suitcase.

After getting Doom to run without graphical output, as proof it could be done, the team was not only able to get actual graphics running with the game in software rendering mode, but it was also able to swap out Doom‚Äôs fictional skybox with real images of the Earth, processed by a machine learning algorithm to adapt to Doom‚Äôs strict palette limit of 256 colors. The team had to tweak the color palette a bit to allow for more than Doom usually does, but the results worked. Not only did Doom run in space, but it ran in space while using a skybox featuring images taken by the very satellite it was running on.

So yes, Doom has run on everything and everywhere, including a satellite in space.



https://kotaku.com/doom-port-runs-on-satellite-esa-op-sat-ubuntu-2000640805

item.title: All Fortnite Simpsons Season Quests And How To Complete Them
item.content:encoded:
With The Simpsons taking over Fortnite battle royale, we've been duking it out on a new, cel-shaded island based on Springfield, the home of the long-running sitcom's titular family. Naturally, the island is full of references to the show, both big and small, and you can earn a healthy chunk of XP toward the new Simpsons-themed battle pass by finding some of them. On top of that, we've got a set of story quests to start us off, as well as some found quests that literally pop out of treasure chests occasionally.

There's a little less hand-holding than usual with these quests, since Fortnite doesn't even tell you what a lot of them are--sometimes you find out a quest exists only after you finish it. But we got you covered. Read on for explanations for all of Fortnite's new Simpsons quests.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • How to complete the Fortnite x Simpsons nuclear power plant event
  • Fortnite x Simpsons Hidden Gags quests
    • Knock the Jebediah Springfield statue's head off
    • Spray Springfield with El Barto tags
    • Step on a rake
    • Release the hounds
    • Dislodge the Lard Lad donut
    • Prank call Moe
    • Bring the Haw Haw humiliation
    • Find Mr. Sparkle
    • Jump the Springfield Gorge
    • Sit on the Simpsons' couch
    • Eat a Steamed Ham
    • Catch Blinky
  • Fortnite X Simpsons story quests - Apocalypse D'oh
    • Visit three named locations
    • Destroy five of Homer's signs
    • Emote near a boss NPC
    • Do 250 damage to bosses
    • Convince Homer to give up the power
    • Visit Town Hall to voice your concerns
    • Find a Squishee
    • Deliver it to Homer
    • Enter the Simpsons house and inspect different remotes
    • Confront Homer
    • Return to Hope
  • Fortnite x Simpsons Lost and Found quests
    • Marge's Lost and Found quests
    • Homer's Lost and Found quests
    • Lisa's Lost and Found quests
    • Bart's Lost and Found quests
  • Kickstart quests
    • Visit the Simpsons house
    • Defeat two bosses or elite guards
    • Raise the flag at Kamp Krusty
    • Secure KBBL Radio Towers two times
    • Damage opponents with Mr. Blasty (1,000 points of damage)
    • Damage Dober Men (300 points of damage)
    • Search Mr. Burns Mystery Boxes
    • Travel distance while sprinting under the effects of Super Squishee
    • Use the Zero Point dash four times after consuming a Blinky Fish
    • Complete a Lost and Found quest

How to complete the Fortnite x Simpsons nuclear power plant event

Whenever the circle is going to close in and leave the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant in the storm, the plant goes into meltdown. If you're there when this happens, you'll see an icon directing you to the plant's control room, where you'll need to enter a sequence using the three buttons--Eenie, Meenie, and Minie--to avert disaster and receive some sick loot.

Unfortunately, the sequence is random each match, but you can find out what the code is by looking for these posters around the plant. Using the sequence from the poster should complete the event.

A new type of milestone this season simply tells you to find 12 "hidden gags" around the island, with no further details. All 12 tasks are listed below, with instructions for how to complete them. Each of these is worth 5k XP the first time you do them, and completing all 12 is another 20k. Some of these quests also grant stashes of loot and/or gold.

Knock the Jebediah Springfield statue's head off

In the Springfield Town Square is a statue of the town's founder, Jebediah Springfield. You can knock the head off this statue by shooting it or hitting it with your pickaxe to complete the quest. And then you can wear the head, which will protect you from all damage the next time an enemy shoots you in the head.

Spray Springfield with El Barto tags

In every named location, you'll find walls with a little spraycan icon on them. Opening the emote wheel while next to one of these will let you tag the wall with the El Barto spray to complete the quest.

Step on a rake

Leaf rakes are lying on the ground in grassy areas all over the map. Stepping on one will make the handle fly up and hit you in the face.

Release the hounds

In Mayor Burns' office in Burns Manor, you'll find a big red button on the large wooden desk at the center of the room. Pressing this button will release a bunch of Dober Man NPCs who will fight any hostile players who enter the area.

Dislodge the Lard Lad donut

In the Donut District, you can damage the Lard Lad statue to knock the giant donut off of it--turning the donut into a large physics object that can destroy buildings and cause other havoc.

Prank call Moe

Most of the major locations have several ringing payphones you can interact with. Doing so will have Bart prank call Moe, which will grant you some gold.

Bring the Haw Haw humiliation

Defeating a boss NPC--Witch Marge, Evil Homer, or Krusty the Clown--prompts Nelson to pop up and laugh at the dead baddie. Meaning defeating any boss completes this quest. Unfortunately, the bosses don't have consistent spawn locations, so it's tough to predict where to find them. But they always begin in or near one of the named locations.

Find Mr. Sparkle

You can find this cleaning solution under some dirt in the corner of the Tire Fire, just south of Evergreen Terrace.

Jump the Springfield Gorge

Just east of Evergreen Terrace is a large gorge with a dirt ramp next to it. Simply jump the gorge while hitting the hoop hovering above it to complete the quest. Using a car is the most obvious way to do this, but using Shockwave Grenades, Super Squishees, or Blinky fish to jump through the hoop on foot is also valid.

Sit on the Simpsons' couch

The iconic Simpsons home is located in the center of Evergreen Terrace--you'll know you're in the right place because the Marge NPC will be hanging out there. Interact with the couch in the living room to complete the quest.

Eat a Steamed Ham

While you're at the Simpsons' house for the previous quest, pop into the dining room where you should find a platter of steamed ham sandwiches. Platters like this also pop up in restaurants and other homes. So if the Simpsons' house doesn't have any, try Ned Flanders' house next door.

Catch Blinky

This quest is telling you to catch a fish with a fishing rod. While there are rivers flowing all over the island, none of them is suitable for fishing. Instead, you'll need to look for swirling fishing spots in the lake next to Kamp Krusty, and in the ocean surrounding the island. Catching one Blinky fish will complete the quest.

Fortnite X Simpsons story quests - Apocalypse D'oh

The first stage of the season's story quests, Apocalypse D'oh, is live now. These quests don't give any XP on their own, but you'll receive 30k XP for every three story or found quests you complete, until you've completed 30 of them. You'll have to do these quests in order, and you can find step-by-step instructions below.

This set of story quests will only be available until November 10, at which time they'll be replaced with the next set of story quests.

Visit three named locations

This one is as simple as it sounds. Simply visit any three different named locations, over the course of however many matches you want.

Destroy five of Homer's signs

Many of the named locations around the map are filled with goofy signs that Homer has put up--like "go" signs instead of "stop" signs, or the sign that indicates it's illegal to be Ned Flanders. Destroy five of these signs, which will be marked on your UI with an exclamation point, to move on to the next quest.

Emote near a boss NPC

You'll need to find one of the boss NPCs--Witch Marge, Evil Homer, and Krusty the Clown--that spawn randomly in any of the named locations, and then emote when you're close to them. Just don't emote for too long, since they'll probably start shooting at you.

Do 250 damage to bosses

Once you've danced with the boss, shoot it. Once you've caused 250 damage, you'll move on to the next stage.

Convince Homer to give up the power

The Homer NPC lives at the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant. Just interact with Homer and choose the marked quest dialogue about the Zero Point shard he found.

Visit Town Hall to voice your concerns

Homer wants you to do some lobbying on his behalf before he'll give up on whatever he's trying to do with the shard. So head to Springfield Town Hall in Corruption Corners, where you'll be prompted to destroy 25 objects before the cops show up and arrest you--you'll have 90 seconds, which is plenty of time.

Find a Squishee

Homer also wants a Super Squishee drink, so you'll need to find one from any source, like treasure chests and Squishee machines that are found in every Qwik-E-Mart around the island--you can buy three Squishees for 300 gold from these machines.

Deliver it to Homer

You'll need to bring Homer the Super Squishee, but you'll need to take a specific route marked by checkpoint hoops--going directly to him by any other path won't count. You'll have four minutes from the moment you enter a Kwik-E-Mart or pick up a Squishee to complete the quest, or else you'll have to start this stage again.

Enter the Simpsons house and inspect different remotes

Homer is being stubborn, so you'll need to visit the Simpsons' home in Evergreen Terrace to investigate what he's planning. Once you're there, you'll need to inspect five remote controls, which are scattered around the house and marked with exclamation points.

Confront Homer

All that's left from here is talking. Return once again to Homer at the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant, and click through the quest dialogue to complete this stage.

Return to Hope

Then, visit the NPC Hope at the donut shop in Donut District, and click through her quest dialogue to complete the first wave of story quests for Fortnite's Simpsons season.

Fortnite x Simpsons Lost and Found quests

You won't find these quests in your menu, because they drop from treasure chests and ammo boxes, and you can also pick one up from the NPCs who offer them, which are Homer, Marge, Lisa, and Bart. These repeatable quests award high-quality loot for each one that you complete, as well as 1k XP. Plus, there's the 30k XP you receive for every three found or story quests you do, until you've done 30 of them.

There are four types of these quests right now, one for each member of the Simpson clan.

Marge's Lost and Found quests

Marge wants you to collect some items, either several of the same thing, or different items of a certain rarity--like three uncommon items, which are green rarity.

Homer's Lost and Found quests

Homer's quests involve driving a distance in a vehicle. Just find a car, and do some driving.

Lisa's Lost and Found quests

Lisa will task you with finding her lost textbooks, which are scattered around whichever named location is nearest. You'll need to look for exclamation points on your mini-map to see where the books are, since they spawn randomly around each location.

Bart's Lost and Found quests

Bart's quests require you to be destructive, either by damaging enemies or breaking stuff.

Kickstart quests

Finally, we have the season-long Kickstart quests that exist to encourage you to get acquainted with the new mechanics in Fortnite's Simpsons season. These are fairly simple and uncomplicated, and we'll explain them all below. Each of these quests is worth 30k XP.

Visit the Simpsons house

In the center of Evergreen Terrace, on the east side of the central square, is the iconic Simpsons house, pictured above for reference. Entering it will complete this quest.

Defeat two bosses or elite guards

The three boss NPCs--Evil Homer, Witch Marge, and Krusty the Clown--spawn randomly in named locations each match, but you can also find Dober Man guards near the KBBL Radio Towers. You can also spawn Dober Man guards by pressing the big red button on the desk in Burns Manor. Defeat two of them to complete the quest.

Raise the flag at Kamp Krusty

There's a control point at Kamp Krusty that's been graced with a Camp Bart flag. Capture it to complete the quest.

Secure KBBL Radio Towers two times

These radio towers are serving at the storm forecast towers this season. Defeat the Dober Man guards and deliver the keycard they dropped to the radio tower for a weather forecast. Do this twice to complete the quest.

Damage opponents with Mr. Blasty (1,000 points of damage)

Mr. Blasty is a new revolver in the loot pool this season, which drops from all normal sources of loot. You just need to shoot your enemies with it--bosses and other NPC enemies count for this.

Damage Dober Men (300 points of damage)

The Dober Man guards can be found at KBBL Radio Towers, and in Burns Manor if you press the red button on the desk in Burns' office.

Search Mr. Burns Mystery Boxes

Instead of normal blue chests, Simpsons season has added these question mark-covered boxes with enhanced loot. Search two of them to complete the quest.

Travel distance while sprinting under the effects of Super Squishee

Drinking a Super Squishee drink, which can be purchased from any Qwik-E-Mart, gives you unlimited sprint, low gravity, and fast sprint for a limited time. Sprint for 250 meters while under that effect to complete the quest. You'll need to stay on the ground for this one, though, as distance traveled in the air doesn't count.

Use the Zero Point dash four times after consuming a Blinky Fish

Eating a Blinky fish will give you a dash ability for a short time. Just hit the jump button while you're in the air to dash in any direction--the quest will complete after you've dashed four times.

Complete a Lost and Found quest

Complete any of the quests in the Lost and Found section above for this one.



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/all-fortnite-simpsons-season-quests-and-how-to-complete-them/1100-6535867/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Fortnite Disabled The Simpsons Couch After There Was A Fortnite Couch Gag For The Show
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A weird invincibility exploit has apparently led to Epic Games disabling The Simpsons couch in Fortnite. That means players can't take a seat on the iconic piece of animated furniture currently. The timing is also unfortunate, since last night's Simpsons episode featured an opening couch gag with Fortnite characters.

The official Fortnite Status account on X posted about the couch issue at 8:05 PM ET on November 2, which is literally five minutes after The Simpsons started last night. The couch gag saw poor Peely meet an unfortunate fate and brought an unsettling new meaning to Fortnite skin. Meanwhile, an account named Relishh on X believes the couch was disabled in-game because the interaction could lead to invincibility for players.

üõãÔ∏è We‚Äôve temporarily disabled the Simpsons Couch in Fortnite to fix an issue.
We‚Äôll fix this and get you and the squad back on the couch to clip your own Simpsons intros as soon as we can.

‚Äî Fortnite Status (@FortniteStatus) November 3, 2025

The odd glitch reportedly required bringing Homer's car to the furniture, pickaxing the vehicle to zero health, then sitting on the couch. This would lead to an explosion and player's health being set to zero permanently. A squadmate then could revive the Fortnite player, making them invincible for the rest of the match.

The Simpsons season just went live in Fortnite over the weekend. The collaboration has seen the entire island transformed into a Springfield map, featuring show locations like the nuclear power plant where Homer works, Moe's Tavern, and of course the home of the Simpsons with their couch. The battle-royale game's Battle Pass is all about the long-running animated show, too, and players can even unlock a Stupid Sexy Flanders skin.

Of course, this won't be the last Fortnite collaboration. In fact, dataminers are suggesting that upcoming crossovers could include SpongeBob SquarePants and Harry Potter.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Japanese publishers like Bandai Namco and Square Enix are requesting Sora 2 is no longer trained on their creative works
item.content:encoded:
A collection of Japanese publishers including Bandai Namco, Square Enix, and others have come together as part of CODA (Content Overseas Distribution Association) to request Open AI cease training AI video generation tool Sora 2 on their collective creative works.

The statement to Open AI, made public via a statement published on the CODA website, state that CODA, requests that CODA members works are not used for machine learning without prior permission, and that Open AI responds sincerely to claims and inquires from CODA members regarding copyright infringement related to Sora 2's output.

The statement also mentions Sora 2's opt out policy, that being that copyrighted works will be used by Sora 2 unless copyright owners specifically opt out themselves. Coda emphasises that this goes against Japanese copyright infringement laws in which permission is required beforehand. Coda also noted that: "there is no system allowing one to avoid liability for infringement through subsequent objections."

Coda is a substantial organisation in Japan that is responsible for copyright protection through combating piracy, as well as the legal worldwide distribution of Japanese video games, movies, music, T.V, and animation. It has a wide variety of members, including companies like Bandai Namco, Cygames, Toei, Square Enix, and more.

Coda is among many with serious copyright concerns in regard to AI models such as Sora 2. AI company Anthropic agreed to pay $1.5bn to authors to settle a copyright lawsuit earlier this year, while a wide variety of ongoing lawsuits are currently in the works (all of which can be tracked on this handy Wired article)

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/japanese-publishers-like-bandai-namco-and-square-enix-are-requesting-sora-2-is-no-longer-trained-on-their-creative-works

item.title: Open-world spy games don't work - that's why Rockstar abandoned PlayStation-exclusive spy game Agent
item.content:encoded:
"What makes them really good as film stories makes them not work as video games."

It's been a long-running mystery why Rockstar's PlayStation-exclusive spy game Agent never materialised. It was announced with much fanfare in 2007, then proceeded to never show up again. But Rockstar co-founder Dan Houser has finally provided an adequate answer. Simply put, he and Rockstar couldn't find a way to make an open-world spy game work.

"We worked a lot on multiple iterations of an open-world spy game and it never came together," Houser told Lex Fridman in a rare and revealing podcast interview. Houser said there were roughly five different iterations of Agent, including one set in the 1970s Cold War era and another set in the modern day.

But wherever and whenever Rockstar tried setting Agent, it couldn't make the idea of an open-world spy game work. "I don't think it works," Houser said. "I concluded - and I keep thinking about it; sometimes I lie in bed thinking about it - that what makes them really good as film stories makes them not work as video games.

Watch on YouTube

"Those films, they're very frenetic and they go beat to beat to beat," he went on. "You've got to go here to save the world, you've got to go there and stop that person being killed and then save the world... And an open-world game does have moments like that when the story comes together, but for large portions it's a lot looser and you're just hanging out and doing what you want."

What makes the Grand Theft Auto and Red Dead Redemption games work so well as open worlds is their in-between time - the time you have to cruise around, either on a horseback or in a car, listening to the radio or watching the world go by. In those games, you do your own thing. "That's why it works well being a criminal: because you fundamentally don't have anyone telling you what to do," Houser said.

The minute you put that into a spy game, however, you slacken the line of tension you need running through the spy framework to give missions jeopardy. "As a spy that doesn't really work because you have to be against the clock," Houser said. It's a fundamental issue - one Rockstar couldn't overcome. "For me, I question whether you can make a good open-world spy game," he said.

It's a question I'm sure Hitman developer IO Interactive has had to reckon with while plotting blockbuster James Bond game 007: First Light, though IOI's expertise is not in open worlds but sandbox mission approaches.

Agent apparently began life as a demo for the Grand Theft Auto 4 engine, a Rockstar developer revealed a couple of years ago, and it showcased a hang glider and a car that turned into a submarine. A fuller, more linear game was then apparently green-lit, which would take us to classic spy movie locations such as the French Riviera, a Swiss ski resort, and Cairo. And the story would culminate with a big shootout with lasers in space. That idea was apparently in development for a year and a downhill skiing section was developed, but the game didn't get much further. Rockstar eventually abandoned its trademark for Agent in 2018.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/open-world-spy-games-dont-work-thats-why-rockstar-abandoned-playstation-exclusive-spy-game-agent

item.title: Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment Arrives on Nintendo Switch 2 This Week
item.content:encoded:
Four years after the last Hyrule Warriors release, Omega Force, the studio behind Age of Calamity within Koei Tecmo, is set to release Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment exclusively on Nintendo Switch 2 later this week on November 6, 2025.

Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment sets players in the Imprisoning War, the events of which would lead to the story that unfolds in The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom. Princess Zelda fights alongside King Rauru and the legendary Sages, each with unique fighting styles that players can utilize in this musou-style game.

The latest trailer showcases a bit more gameplay ahead of launch, like the kinds of combination attacks you can perform with other characters to decimate waves of enemies.

When Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity came out in 2020 on the Nintendo Switch, Wccftech's reviewer noted that one of the key drawbacks to the game was its poor framerate and performance, writing, "I genuinely had a minute where I was positive that the game's framerate had dropped into the single digits for a lengthy period of time. Playing co-op with two characters which both have heavy effects on their attacks is a recipe for a low framerate, and a low number of enemies being drawn on screen. It's a shame as co-op is still the best way to play any Warriors game, but the framerate sacrifice and loss of screen real-estate can make it feel more like a hassle than a fun way to play with friends."

Even though the game was able to sell over 3 million copies before the end of the year, setting a new record for the Warriors series, its performance issues continued to be a refrain that harmed players' perception of the game.

Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment, as a Nintendo Switch 2 exclusive, has the chance to shirk the bad performance narrative if it's able to launch mostly issue-free thanks to the power of the Switch 2 hardware. Of course, it's naive to think any major game will launch completely without bugs, but hopefully we won't see the kinds of major performance issues that held back Age of Calamity.

item.title: First Super Mario Galaxy Movie Trailer Reportedly Coming This Month
item.content:encoded:
The first full Super Mario Galaxy Movie trailer is reportedly coming later this month. In fact, it could be coming within the next few weeks.

According to MyTimeToShine, a movie outlet with accurate reports in the past, the next trailer for the upcoming movie is set to premiere in theaters ahead of Wicked For Good on November 21. Originally, plans seemed to call for it to debut in theaters before Zootopia 2, which launches on November 26.

In addition to its theatrical showing, the outlet adds that it should appear online beforehand.

‚ÄúThe trailer will drop online before November 21st, and then make its theatrical debut with Wicked For Good,‚Äù they said. ‚ÄúThat releases a week before Zootopia 2. It could still play before Zootopia 2, but that won‚Äôt be its official cinema debut.‚Äù

Confirmed during September‚Äôs Nintendo Direct, the Super Mario Galaxy Movie is the sequel to the highly successful The Super Mario Bros. Movie from 2023. The sequel will see Chris Pratt return as Mario, along with Anya Taylor-Joy as Princess Peach, Charlie Day as Luigi, Keegan-Michael Key as Toad, Jack Black as Bowser, and Kevin Michael Richardson as Kamek.

The Super Mario Galaxy Movie is scheduled to release in theaters on April 3, 2026. Its release will mark exactly three years to the day of the original‚Äôs launch.

What are you hoping to see from the upcoming trailer for The Super Mario Galaxy Movie? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Nicktoons & the Dice of Destiny coming to Switch 2 on December 5
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Increased resolution, frame rate, and more.

Publisher GameMill Entertainment and developers Fair Play Labs and Petit Fabrik will release four-player cooperative action RPG Nicktoons & the Dice of Destiny for Switch 2 on December 5, the companies announced. The physical edition will ship on a game-key card.

Nicktoons & the Dice of Destiny first launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam on September 30.

Compared to the Switch version, the Switch 2 version will feature increased resolution to 1240p, a frame rate of 60 frames per second, and improved lighting, particle effects, anti-aliasing, and more.

All physical and digital owners of the original Switch version of Nicktoons & the Dice of Destiny will be able to access the same enhancements when playing on a Switch 2 via a free performance update expected to launch alongside the Switch 2 version.

Here is an overview of the game, via GameMill Entertainment:

About

Embark on a fantastical quest with your favorite Nicktoons characters‚Äîreimagined as epic action RPG heroes!

Nicktoons & The Dice of Destiny is a vibrant, universe-spanning mashup that brings iconic Nickelodeon heroes into a world of fantasy-style tropes and real-time RPG action. Get ready to roll the dice and dive into a wild, action-packed adventure with SpongeBob, Katara, Leonardo, and others as they swing spatulas, bend water, slice katanas, and more. Get ready for epic battles, dynamic environments, and recognizable character moments, all with an engaging gameplay experience for players of all ages.

Key Features

  • Play as Legendary Nickelodeon Characters‚ÄîFantasy Style ‚Äì Suit up as SpongeBob SquarePants, Katara, Leonardo, Sandy Cheeks, Timmy Turner, Susie Carmichael, Danny Phantom, Jimmy Neutron, and Jenny Wakeman, each reimagined into classic RPG character classes from Spellcaster and Wizard to Barbarian and Knight, and more. Every hero comes with their own unique powers and weapons.
  • Real-Time, Action-Packed Battles ‚Äì Slash, cast spells, and strategize your way through fast-paced, fluid combat. Master each character‚Äôs unique style and time your combos to perfection.

    Explore Whimsical Worlds ‚Äì From Bikini Bottomshire to the Ghost Zone, journey through colorful, Nickelodeon-inspired fantasy lands with fun, reimagined twists ‚Äì each filled with puzzles, secrets, side quests, and wonderful surprises.

  • Conquer Epic Boss Battles ‚Äì Face off against iconic enemies like Azula, Angelica, and Plankton in intense boss battles ‚Äì each fight offering unique mechanics and surprises‚Äîleading up to an unforgettably climactic final encounter.
  • Single-Player or Local Cooperative Play for One-to-Four Players ‚Äì Team up with friends and build your party! Mix and match characters for the perfect balance of skills and chaos in your local squad.
  • Level Up and Customization ‚Äì Unlock new powers, upgrade your weapons, and shape your heroes‚Äô path through this awesome adventure.
  • Built for Nick Fans and Action RPG Lovers ‚Äì Whether you‚Äôre a lifelong Nickelodeon fan or a fantasy RPG adventurer, Nicktoons & The Dice of Destiny blends charm, fast-paced fun, and adventure together in one unforgettable quest.

item.title: GTA 6 Warrants A $100 Price Tag, GTA 5 Actor Says
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

It remains to be seen what price Rockstar Games will charge for the eagerly awaited Grand Theft Auto VI, but some are speculating that it could be $80, $90, or even $100. Nothing is confirmed right now, but GTA 5 actor Jay Klaitz--who played Lester--has now said he believes GTA 6 warrants a $100 price tag due to the content it's expected to offer.

"These games take so long to make. Years and years and years. It's not like they‚Äôve just been hanging out, chilling and then just started doing the work last year. They finished GTA V and then started on GTA VI more or less immediately thereafter," he told The Escapist. "This sh** takes forever and as we saw with GTA V the game will come out and there will be other versions, there will be downloadable content, it will be online. You're almost buying multiple games when you buy the one."

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: EVERYTHING You Missed In The GTA 6 Trailer

Klaitz said there is also a case to be made for making GTA 6 priced at a level where it can be "more accessible," but if it is $100, that would make sense to him.

"I would also like to see it made more accessible to more fans so I get that side of the argument too to make it affordable for folks. That's cool too. Maybe there's like a way to split the difference, but I share the sentiment that this game warrants that price tag. Yeah, I get that," he said.

Sales data for video games shows that people are ready and willing to pay $80 or more for new games, but it's still anyone's guess as to the price for GTA 6. Other experts believe $70 is the right price. At least one developer maintains that GTA 6 "deserves" to be $100 due to the size and scope of the project. Some have said the game does not need to be $100 because the game's expected online mode could be the real money-maker.

The discussion around a possible $100 price for GTA 6 stems back to researcher Matthew Ball, who said in a memo in January 2025 that "there is hope" from people in gaming that GTA 6 could be priced between $80 and $100. He pointed out that, adjusted for inflation, GTA 4 was priced at $90 and GTA 5 was $83. Things like movie tickets, rent, subscription services like Spotify and Netflix, gas, groceries, and numerous other items have gone up in price while video games have remained at "record lows," Ball said. His own personal prediction is that GTA 6 will be priced at $70.

Also in the interview, Klaitz said he would like to see a future GTA game take place outside America and possibly go somewhere like Dubai. "You could be in like a big city with huge skyscrapers but then you‚Äôre out in the desert one minute later. GTA: Dubai would give you a lot of fun environments and scenarios to play with and build a game on," he said, adding that other options could be the North Pole or Greenland.

Klaitz also talked about the possibility of a GTA TV series, saying it would be "really cool to try to pull off," adding that he would personally like to see it be a live-action show as opposed to animation.

"It would be tough to translate because it's that sandbox-type game and people can do whatever they want, wherever they want, whenever they want. It's hard to sort of refocus that into a straight narrative. But it would be fun to try," he said.

GTA 6 launches in May 2026 for PS5 and Xbox Series X|S.

item.title: Disney And Fortnite Unite With New Mandalorian Smugglers Run Mission -- Report
item.content:encoded:

After months of teasing, Disney's Millennium Falcon: Smugglers Run ride at Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge will receive a major update in 2026 and could connect to the ongoing events in Fortnite. According to insider Drew Smith, the new mission will feature The Mandalorian and Grogu, giving guests a fresh adventure inside the Star Wars universe.

CONFIRMED: Millennium Falcon: Smugglers Run‚Äôs new Mandalorian and Grogu mission will connect to the Disney games and entertainment universe coming to Fortnite.
The mission will leverage Epic Games‚Äô Unreal Engine for ‚Äúseamless, cross-platform storytelling.‚Äù
Disney says that‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/5anYpmW6Re

‚Äî Drew Smith (@DrewDisneyDude) November 2, 2025

Disney's partnership with Epic Games aims to bring advanced technology and interactive storytelling to theme parks. While the collaboration between Disney and Epic is official, Smith reports that the connection between the upcoming Disney x Fortnite universe will create "seamless, cross-platform storytelling" between parks, games, and other entertainment.

However, Disney and Epic have not yet made a public statement confirming how this connection will work. Earlier reports and leaks have hinted that Disney‚Äôs $1.5 billion investment in Epic Games is funding a large-scale online world where progress from park attractions could influence gameplay in Fortnite. For example, guests who complete the new Smugglers Run mission might earn in-game rewards or status in the Disney x Fortnite experience--but this has not yet been officially detailed.

Still, Disney executives have stated that the company's future lies in connecting movies, games, and attractions into one shared digital ecosystem. The upcoming Smugglers Run update may be the first clear step in that direction, combining storytelling, gaming technology, and theme park interactivity in ways that blur the line between real and virtual worlds.

item.title: DHS Will Continue Co-Opting Gaming and Movie Imagery Like Halo and Lord of the Rings For Its Social Media Posts
item.content:encoded:
Following the reveal of Halo: Campaign Evolved, which confirmed that the longtime Xbox-exclusive series would be coming to PlayStation, GameStop posted a lengthy statement about it being the end of the console wars. The White House, of all entities, responded with an AI-generated photo of Donald Trump in Spartan armor, as if to depict him as the protagonist in Halo, Master Chief. Shortly after that, the US Department of Homeland Security (DHS) used more Halo imagery to promote its own political agenda, and has even followed it up with a similar post co-opting Lord of the Rings.

And the DHS has made it clear that it will not stop there, which we know thanks to a report from independent journalist Alyssa Mercante, who obtained a statement from the DHS after inquiring about its use of Halo imagery. At the time of her inquiry, the Lord of the Rings post had not been made, though it would go out shortly after this statement was delivered:

"We will reach people where they are with content they can relate to and understand, whether that be Halo, Pok√©mon, Lord of The Rings, or any other medium. DHS remains laser focused on bringing awareness to the flood of crime that criminal illegal aliens have inflicted on our country. We aren‚Äôt slowing down. - DHS SPOX"

Microsoft has yet to make an official comment on the DHS using Halo to promote its own political agenda, nor has Amazon, which currently holds the rights to The Lord of the Rings, made a statement regarding whether the use of these images was approved.

Both Amazon and Microsoft, if they were so inclined, could have the images taken down, and while the lack of any statement doesn't explicitly confirm they agree with the posts in question and how they are being used, not saying anything at the very least admits that neither party will stop the DHS from continuing to use franchises like Halo and The Lord of the Rings in the future.

Individual Halo creators have made statements, however, with Marcus Lehto, a co-creator of Halo and the lead designer of the character Master Chief, told Game File that "It really makes me sick seeing Halo co-opted like this."

Jaime Griesemer, a lead designer of the original Halo games at Bungie, added, "Halo is a cultural icon and like anything with cultural capital, it is going to be used by politicians and brands and anyone else looking for relevancy. Usually, I take it as a compliment to Halo‚Äôs continuing legacy."

"Using Halo imagery in a call to ‚Äòdestroy‚Äô people because of their immigration status goes way too far, and ought to offend every Halo fan, regardless of political orientation. I personally find it despicable. The Flood are evil space zombie parasites and are not an allegory to any group of people."

item.title: The Game Awards Needs A Puzzle Category
item.content:encoded:
Why is the old Path of Exile more popular than the sequel right now? How does co-op horror game Mimesis copy teammates‚Äô voices? And what‚Äôs the real difference between a remake and remaster these days? It‚Äôs the latest edition of Morning Checkpoint, Kotaku‚Äòs daily roundup of gaming news and culture. Digital Foundry has a new retro gaming podcast. It‚Äôs very good and you should go check it out.

Where are all the puzzle award categories for games?

It‚Äôs a question bubbled up across my feed over the weekend. The Game Awards has genre shout-outs for role-playing games, action games, and even family games, whatever that means (it‚Äôs usually shorthand for whatever Nintendo put out that year). But other popular genres like horror and even shooters don‚Äôt get any special consideration. With puzzle games, that short shrift feels especially acute, however.

That‚Äôs because there are lots of great puzzle games lately that just don‚Äôt usually have a shot of winning Best Game or the indie categories they‚Äôre otherwise most often represented in, like ‚ÄúGames for Impact.‚Äù A puzzle category in 2025 would be full of strong contenders, including Blue Prince, The Roottress are Dead, and the recently launched The S√©ance of Blake Manor.

Even Double Fine‚Äôs excellent Keeper might be more likely to get an honorary mention with a best puzzle category than awkwardly shoving it into best indie game (that happens to be published by the largest game publisher in the world).

Fans discuss whether to boycott Hyper Light Drifter dev‚Äôs next game after layoffs

‚ÄúHard to support devs when they can no longer see a cent from a game,‚Äù wrote one user on the Steam discussion page for Possessor(s), PC Gamer reports. Heart Machine has undergone multiple rounds of layoffs over the last year and put its Early Access action-RPG Hyper Light Breaker on ice. But publisher Devolver Digital said laid off staff are still eligible for revenue sharing from the game‚Äôs sales, and ‚ÄúAs a developer who is slated for lay off‚ÄîPLEASE BUY THIS GAME,‚Äù former narrative director Tyler Hutchinson told Steam players.

This same issue has come up recently with news of alleged union busting at Rockstar Games. Some fans have immediately called for a boycott of Grand Theft Auto 6, despite no indication from any of the fired developers that that‚Äôs what they want to happen in response. Consumers can choose to spend their money however they want, but it‚Äôs usually good to check with the people you‚Äôre trying to support before launching a boycott in their name.

Remasters sell, but remakes sell better

That‚Äôs according to new research from Ampere Analysis as reported by VGC. The data firm counted 15 remakes and 27 remasters released between January 2024 and September 2025. It found that remakes generated 2.2 times the revenue of remasters, despite only being released half as often. Of course, the Ampere also counted games like Oblivion Remastered as, well, a remaster, even though it certainly veers more into the territory of a remake.

Peak is getting a new Kashyyyk biome

It‚Äôs called Roots. It‚Äôs full oe redwood trees. And it seems like there will be lots of spiders.

Mimesis is a new co-op horror game that copies your voice

That‚Äôs one of the ways its enemies try to trick players into thinking they‚Äôre on the same team. It‚Äôs the latest crew-like to quietly have a big week on Steam after arriving in Early Access on October 27.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs pretty much a Lethal Company clone but with an LLM mimic feature that actually tries to make sense out of the voice clips it gets per session,‚Äù is how one user described it. There‚Äôs no generative-AI disclosure on Steam page so it‚Äôs unclear how the whole thing works.

The original Path of Exile has exploded on Steam again thanks to a new update

Patch 3.27 is called Keepers of the Flame and arrived on November 1. The action-RPG hit over 180,000 concurrents on Steam over the weekend after it went live. The massive update focuses on an invasion of Breach Monster and includes tons of changes to skills, characters, and everything else in the game for what is essentially it‚Äôs next big season.

ICYMI:

  • The small penis pinching controversy, explained
  • Nobody thinks Silksong has a chance at GOTY 
  • Switch streamer owes Nintendo $17,500 after trying to troll them

Watch this:



https://kotaku.com/tga-game-awards-goty-puzzle-mimesis-poe-2000640780

item.title: Dispatch Brings Back One Of The Worst Parts Of Telltale Games
item.content:encoded:
Ever since choice-based games moved away from dialogue options in which you see exactly what your character will say before they say it in favor of little blurbs that try to sum up the general vibe of what you‚Äôre going to say or do before you watch it unfold on-screen, there‚Äôs been a loss of clarity between what we think we‚Äôre about to say and what we actually end up doing in video games. Part of me thinks this is just the consequence of a more cinematic approach to choice-based games, but poorly communicating what a player will do when they make a decision is a game design issue, and Dispatch, the first project from AdHoc Studio, made up of several ex-Telltale developers, is one of the latest games to fall victim to this incongruity between what the screen says your characters will do and what actually ends up happening after you choose it.

Studios have found different ways to circumvent this danger. BioWare uses emotive icons to communicate an emotional intent with different options, or has even started adding small pop-up windows to lay out exactly what you‚Äôre going to do alongside your dialogue option. However, games like Dragon Age: The Veilguard have the advantage of pausing dialogue to let players consider their actions before moving forward. Dispatch, like many of the old Telltale games, including The Walking Dead and Tales from the Borderlands, has timed dialogue choices to create a sense of urgency and keep a scene flowing. That has its advantages, but it also means you can‚Äôt include a bunch of clarifying pop-ups like other games might because players won‚Äôt have time to read them all thoroughly. That said, you can also just write dialogue options that are straightforward, rather than obfuscating what you‚Äôre actually going to do. Minor spoilers for Dispatch‚Äôs third episode follow:

In episode three, protagonist Robert Robertson III is gathering his crew of ex-villain dispatchees to let them know that, by the end of their shift, at least one of them will be off the team and in the unemployment line. Exactly who that ends up being is the final decision of the episode, but before you make any such call, the group gathers in a meeting room, and Golem, a sentient pile of mud and dirt, knocks Robert to the floor as he enters the room. The player is given two options here: kick him out, or ‚Äúgive him the chair.‚Äù That could be interpreted as you offering him a chair to sit down on, but if you choose that option, that‚Äôs not what happens. Instead, Robert throws the chair at Golem, which lodges in his shoulder. Robert gives him a very apt talking-to about being aware of his surroundings, but the violence to get there is not clearly communicated in the options you‚Äôre given. It makes for a funny streaming moment, at least, but given Telltale‚Äôs history with these kinds of ambiguous dialogue options, folks aren‚Äôt thrilled to see these interactions return in Dispatch.

Dispatch is halfway through its eight-episode run, and while I‚Äôm enjoying parts of it, I have been feeling a bit railroaded by its decisions thus far. I‚Äôm curious to see just how much impact those choices can make by the time the game ends later this month, but for now, it‚Äôs mostly just felt like I‚Äôve been on the ride.



https://kotaku.com/dispatch-dialogue-options-chair-episode-3-golem-choice-2000640791

item.title: New PS5 Holiday Ad Campaign Teases Gaming Moments Like Botching A Stunt Jump
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

With the holiday season drawing closer--and radio stations warming up their Mariah Carey Christmas playlists--PlayStation is rolling out a new advertising campaign to convince people that the PS5 is the place to be. This year, the theme is "it happens on PS5," and Sony has rolled out three ads showcasing scenes familiar to gamers.

First off, there's the stunt jump showcasing an ambitious--but failed--attempt to do a Superman and make an 18-wheeler leap over a tall building:

"The Unexpected Catch" shows off some fishy body horror that wouldn't look out of place in a David Cronenberg movie:

And finally, "Everyday Problems in Everyday Vehicles" proves that even in a future where interstellar ships are the norm, you just can't beat a good truck when it comes to reliability:

Meanwhile, Xbox has launched its own holiday marketing campaign by leaning into the ex-boxer meme.

This month marks the fifth anniversary of the PS5, as it first went on sale on November 12, 2020. In the years since it launched, the PS5 has reached 80.3 million unit sales as of August 7, 2025, making it race neck-and-neck with its predecessor, the PS4, at the same time during its life-cycle. One area where the PS5 has been a big sales hit is the PlayStation Network, as Sony has grown its user base substantially here.

While November marks a major milestone for the PS5, attention is starting to shift toward the future of the console brand. Amidst talk of a modular design for the rumored PS6 and a reliance on traditional game delivery systems, Sony also recently teased some of the innovative tech that will power its future gaming hardware, which it's developing in partnership with AMD.

item.title: Classic Survival Horror Condemned: Criminal Origins Delisted from Storefronts
item.content:encoded:
Sega and Monolith's classic survival horror game Condemned: Criminal Origins has been delisted from digital storefronts, and no reason has been given by the publisher as to why this has happened.

As spotted by Wario64 over on Bluesky, Condemned was taken down from Steam and the Xbox storefront on Halloween. In case you're wondering, it's not available via GOG either, having not been added to that platform's excellent Preservation Program yet.

Sega hasn't given any kind of official statement regarding the reason for the game's delisting, and since Monolith was shuttered by parent company Warner Bros back in February this year, the developer isn't available to comment on the situation either.

Released back in 2005, Condemned: Criminal Origins is a first-person survival horror game in which you play as Ethan Thomas, an FBI agent who's looking into a spate of serial killings, as well as the homeless population of his city suddenly becoming aggressive and violent.

The game features a mix of tense action-horror combat and exploration, detective mechanics, and mild survival elements. It's a real classic, although I suppose we now have to describe it as a "lost" classic, since it's not available for purchase anymore.

It's possible, of course, that Sega is gearing up to announce a remaster of the game, perhaps alongside remaster and remake connoisseurs Nightdive. That could just be wishful thinking on my part, though; it's equally possible that the game has disappeared for some arcane rights-related reason.

Condemned: Criminal Origins was followed up by a sequel, Condemned 2: Bloodshot, which, unlike its predecessor, was ported to the PlayStation 3 as well as releasing for the Xbox 360. This one, however, never appeared on PC.

Luckily, developers like Dusk's David Szymanski are here to carry the torch, with titles like January's Butcher's Creek attempting to pay homage to Condemned through similar tense first-person survival horror gameplay.

For the time being, sadly, it looks like you'll have to fall back on your physical copy of Condemned: Criminal Origins on Xbox 360 if you want to play it. Hopefully, a remaster or remake is announced soon.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He‚Äôs originally an‚Ä¶ More about Joseph



https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/condemned-criminal-origins-delisted

item.title: Mac Mini Rival Running Windows Hits 40% Off, Christmas Showed Up Early on Amazon
item.content:encoded:
Apple‚Äôs Mac Mini gets all the attention for compact computing but plenty of people need powerful Windows machines that don‚Äôt take up half a desk. Developers running Windows-only software, small business owners managing Microsoft ecosystems, content creators working with Adobe suites, and anyone tired of bulky tower PCs all face the same challenge: serious processing power in a tiny package that runs Windows natively.

The GMKtec M2 Pro S delivers exactly that: an Intel Core i7-1185G7 processor, 32GB RAM, and triple 4K display support, in a case smaller than most hardcover books. Amazon has slashed this mini PC from $639 to $409, placing legitimate desktop-class performance within reach at a price that makes sense.

See at Amazon

Tiger Lake Performance in a Desktop Form Factor

Intel‚Äôs Tiger Lake is its 11th generation of Core i7 mobile chips but GMKtec adapted the Core i7-1185G7 chip for use in desktop mini PCs with great results. This quad-core chip runs at a base frequency of 3.0 GHz and turbos up to 4.8 GHz on single-core workloads with all four cores sustaining 4.3 GHz under full load. Those frequencies matter: They‚Äôre a determinant of how snappy your applications respond, how well your video-editing software scrubs through timelines, and how many browser tabs you can have open before things start crawling. Eight threads through Hyper-Threading technology allow the processor to juggle multiple tasks simultaneously.

It‚Äôs handled by the Intel Iris Xe Graphics with 96 execution units that deliver performance well above older integrated graphics and give even some entry-level dedicated GPUs a run for their money. That matters from smooth desktop animations to hardware-accelerated video encoding, plus casual gaming and the ability to run design software without throwing hundreds of dollars at a separate graphics card

The 32GB of dual-channel DDR4 RAM comes properly configured from the factory, and gives both the CPU and GPU maximum memory bandwidth for the best performance. Dual-channel operation essentially doubles the speed at which data flows between RAM and processor compared to single-channel configurations, eliminating a common bottleneck that cripples many budget systems. The 1TB NVMe SSD connects via PCIe 3.0, delivering read speeds around 3,500 MB/s that make your entire system feel instantaneous compared to old SATA drives or mechanical hard drives.

The triple display capability transforms this mini PC into a serious multitasking powerhouse: Two HDMI 2.0 ports each output 4K resolution at 60Hz, while the USB-C port with DisplayPort alt mode handles the third 4K display at 60Hz. Running three 4K monitors simultaneously gives you over 24 million pixels of workspace, letting traders monitor multiple markets, developers keep code on one screen with documentation and testing on the others, or video editors spread their timeline across displays. The 60Hz refresh rate ensures smooth motion and responsive cursor movement.

The GMKtec mini PC now costs $409, instead of $639, which makes it far cheaper than many standalone processors.

item.title: Today‚Äôs Wordle #1599: Hints And Answer For November 4, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Get ready for an easier Wordle answer than the past few days. Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or a daily player, today‚Äôs tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak‚Äîif you‚Äôre open to a little extra help. So, if you‚Äôve found yourself stuck with today‚Äôs Wordle, don‚Äôt worry, you‚Äôll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1599 on November 4, 2025.

To play today‚Äôs Wordle, head to the game‚Äôs website. If you want to go right to today‚Äôs answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you‚Äôve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today‚Äôs and yesterday‚Äôs editions of Wordle. If you don‚Äôt want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, November 4, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1599 is going to be a tougher puzzle for most players. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today‚Äôs answer takes an average of 5.2 guesses out of 6 to get. That means it‚Äôs a bit higher than the 4.8-guess average on November 3.

General Wordle Hints For November 4

Without giving today‚Äôs Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: The word contains a repeated vowel.
  • Hint 2: It starts with a letter that often signals something a bit formal or official.
  • Hint 3: It‚Äôs a place where people gather for concerts, meetings, or performances.
  • Hint 4: You might buy tickets to get into one.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1599 for November 4, 2025

Starter Words For November 4, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today‚Äôs Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • VENOM
  • NEVER
  • VAUNT

Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer For Game #1599 On November 4, 2025

If you‚Äôve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today‚Äôs Wordle below.

Answer: VENUE

If you solved today‚Äôs Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow‚Äôs puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday‚Äôs Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here‚Äôs yesterday‚Äôs Wordle answer for Game #1598 on November 3, 2025:

Answer: AWOKE

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1597?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on November 5 will be Wordle Game #1600.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn‚Äôt fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

Need more help with other daily games? Let us know what games you‚Äôd like tips and clues for in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: The Simpsons Just Had A Bananas Fortnite Couch Gag, And Poor Peely Didn't Fare Well
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Battle Bus dropped off Peely, Jonesy, Meowscles, and a couple of other Fortnite characters on to The Simpsons for the long-running show's opening couch gag. The crossover starts harmless enough. But then, things go awry for the Fortnite clan--especially the cute-looking banana.

Peely slips trying to run away from the Simpsons, who pull out weapons to get the Fortnite characters to leave their couch. That misstep leads to a terrible fate for poor Peely. The Simpsons turn the character into a banana split, bringing a horrifying new meaning to Fortnite skin. The official Simpsons account on X shared a clip of the opening sequence from last night, November 2.

The crossover is a reciprocation of Fortnite's recently launched Simpsons season. This is a huge collaboration that has replaced the game's normal island with a Springfield-inspired map that's cel-shadded and features locations like Moe's Tavern as well as the Qwik-E-Mart. There's even a Simpsons-specific Battle Pass. Players can earn skins based on Homer, Marge, and even Flounders.

The start of The Simpsons season in Fortnite has seen a spike in player counts, as spotlighted by Shiina on X. The battle-royale game almost hit 2.7 million concurrent players, per Fortnite.gg. To put that number in perspective, that would put Fortnite at No. 2 all time for Steam concurrents--though the big caveat here is Fortnite is available across PC, consoles, and mobile devices. The player count also comes nowhere close to Fortnite's all-time recorded high, which was over 14 million concurrent players roughly a year ago.

Looking ahead, Fortnite dataminers believe they've found evidence pointing to future collaborations with SpongeBob SquarePants and Harry Potter.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/the-simpsons-just-had-a-bananas-fortnite-couch-gag-and-poor-peely-didnt-fare-well/1100-6535878/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: We all know that The Simpsons has come to Fortnite, but did you know that Fornite has also come to the latest episode of The Simpsons?
item.content:encoded:
The Simpsons has a long running couch gag bit, which plays out during the show's title sequence. Sometimes this sees America's yellow cartoon family taking part in a group dance or being abducted by aliens. There are also times when the fivesome are surprised by some unexpected visitors already plopped down in front of the TV, leaving Homer and co with nowhere to park their own rears.

And, that is exactly what has happened in the latest episode of The Simpsons, this time with familiar faces from Fortnite taking a seat at 742 Evergreen Terrace.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

During the opening sequence of The Simpsons' season 37 episode 5 - known as Bad Boys... For Life? - Homer, Marge, Bart, Lisa and Maggie all arrive at home to find the likes of Fishstick there. Not a family to take this intrusion lightly, the Simpsons proceed to draw some weapons on the Fortnite lot and, errrr‚Ä¶ let Peely know who is boss.

You can check out this Fortnite-flavoured The Simpsons couch gag below.

This isn't the first time The Simpsons has given a nod to video games. Last year, during season 35 (I still can't quite believe how long this show has been going for), we got a Mario Kart parody, complete with a moustachiod Lisa and a Bowser-esque Nelson.

As for the here and now, this opening is a timely addition to the show's lineup, with Fortnite itself hosting a The Simpsons season.

If you are playing right now, but need a little helping hand, be sure to check out our guides to point you in the right direction. Here is one on how to use the Zero Point dash after consuming a Blinky Fish in Fortnite's The Simpsons season to get you started.

item.title: The Most Extraordinary Cosplay Fits Out Of New York Comic Con 2025

Is it fair to call this the Big One? Of all the very many nerd conventions around the world, New York Comic Con certainly has claim to be one of the most defining events in the calendar. As you might imagine, New York Comic Con attracts a host of big-name actors and creators, with 2025 seeing the likes of Hollywood stars like James McAvoy, Elliot Page, Martin Sheen and Ming-Na Wen, alongside writers George R.R. Martin and Joe Hill, voice actors Laura Bailey and Ashley Johnson, and all-time heroes like Ernie Hudson, Seth Green and Peter Weller. But we‚Äôre not here for autographs; we‚Äôre after the most impressive cosplay to walk through the exhibition hall doors. And as ever, we have a mighty-fine selection.

More unusual costumes include a spot-on Bad Bunny, a Supergirl/Sabrina Carpenter crossover, and‚Äîer‚Äîquite the Jeff Goldblum. There‚Äôs also the finest Predator I‚Äôve ever seen, and what I hope will become a permanent fixture of these galleries: Demon Hunters‚Äò Derpy.

item.title: Lenovo IdeaPad with Office 365 and 1TB Selling Cheaper Than No-Name Laptops, Amazon Clears Stock
item.content:encoded:
Most people just want a laptop that works without drama or over-engineering. Lenovo‚Äôs IdeaPad line is specifically designed with all the everyday scenarios in mind and peel away the extraneous gaming trim to focus on practical computing that normal people actually need. Right now, Amazon has dropped the Lenovo IdeaPad 1i down to $279 from its regular $399 price, bundling in a full year of Microsoft 365 alongside an impressive combination of 12GB RAM, 256GB SSD storage plus 1TB of cloud storage.

See at Amazon

Real Computing Power for Everyday Tasks

The 12GB of RAM in this configuration changes everything about how budget laptops traditionally perform. Most entry-level machines ship with 4GB that starts choking the moment you open more than a few browser tabs but 12GB gives you real breathing room for multitasking across applications. You can run Word documents (you can download Word for free here) while researching in Chrome with YouTube playing in the background, all without that frustrating slowdown that makes budget laptops feel ancient. The Intel Celeron processor handles everyday computing tasks like email, web browsing, document editing and video streaming without breaking a sweat.

Storage comes in two forms that work together beautifully: fast local storage and massive cloud storage. The 256GB SSD provides fast local storage for your operating system, applications, and files you access regularly, delivering quick boot times and snappy performance that makes modern computers feel responsive. That is complemented by the massive 1TB of cloud storage through Microsoft 365 for backing up photos and everything else you want to keep safe but don‚Äôt need instant access to.

The 14-inch HD anti-glare display hits that sweet spot for portability and usability-large enough to handle comfortable work sessions without the bulk of a 15.6-inch model that barely fits into backpacks: That anti-glare coating does wonders when you work near a window or under strong overhead lighting and cuts down on the reflections that otherwise drive you to push brightness to uncomfortable levels. The screen manages to achieve an 87% active area ratio which means Lenovo has been able to keep the surrounding bezels quite minimal to provide more screen area in a compact form factor. Two Dolby Audio speakers flank the keyboard and stream robust sound surprisingly well for video calls, streaming shows, or background music while working.

Battery life stretches to 11 hours on a full charge which is enough to get through a full workday or school day without hunting for outlets. WiFi-6 connectivity brings faster speeds and better performance in crowded wireless environments like apartments or dorm buildings where dozens of devices compete for bandwidth. The Flip to Start feature powers on the laptop the instant you open the lid and shaves off those annoying seconds of waiting while Smart Noise Cancelling automatically filters out background sounds during video calls.

Windows 11 is preinstalled and it performs all the modern computing tasks you‚Äôd want, from productivity software to entertainment apps. The bundled Microsoft 365 subscription includes all the Office applications you‚Äôd want, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook, along with that 1TB of OneDrive cloud storage we mentioned earlier. This software package alone usually costs about $70 per year so getting a full year included with the laptop counts as genuine added value rather than marketing fluff.

At $279, this Lenovo undercuts generic no-name laptops that often cost $400 or more while delivering inferior build quality and zero brand support.
